Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw two students using a string telephone to communicate over a distance, with a clear depiction of the interaction.
The student can include a basic representation of how sound travels through the string, such as an arrow indicating direction.
The student can label most of the parts of the string telephone, such as the cups and string, though some labels may be missing or incorrect.
The student can attempt to show how the device uses sound to solve the problem of communication over a distance, perhaps with partial success (e.g., including symbols for sound).
The student can demonstrate that only simple materials are used to build the string telephone, correctly drawing materials like paper cups and string.
CANNOT: The student may not fully illustrate the importance of communication over long distances, possibly omitting any depiction of distance (e.g., draw students too close).

The student might not completely or correctly depict the path of sound in the string, such as confusing directions or not showing it in both directions (e.g., missing arrows or mislabeling sound paths).
